Articles.Content:
Greetings gentlemen. Hopefully, for those who like Rock, this will be the megathread for it. So what era in your opinion served the greatest era of rock?

My opinion, sixties and seventies, yet it still reverberates today from the past.

IÂ´m young too, but i prefer the 70s (ACDC, KISS, Queen, Pink Floyd...)

I love guns and roses too and i like Muse
I like a bit of everything from 60\'s through 90\'s and a few songs from the noughties (2000-20009)

I like a bit of everything from 60\'s through 90\'s and a few songs from the noughties (2000-20009)

Ever heard Hendrix?

Ever heard Hendrix?

Jimi Hendrix? Yeah I\'ve heard a few

i like most rock from, well, all the time! im just into everything

( yes, that means dubstep)

so i really have a hard time choosing my favourite rock era. though if had to choose it\'d be 60\'s, closely followed by 80\'s and then to modern heavy rock. though again, i like everything!

I like most stuff by The Doors.

Beyond that I have a fairly eclectic selection of rock, as I do with most music.

Im into a lot of 80\'s but some of the 70\'s and the 90\'s!! My favourite band is Bon Jovi, and my opinion is that their best works were done in the 90\'s, but their 80\'s songs were anthemic!

Also, I am only 16, but I saw the movie Rock of Ages, and that gave me 80\'s nostalgia

My opinion though is that these days music is so terrible I cant listen to the popular radio stations > I hope it circles back, but maybe something will evolve and blow out everything that has been previously done like rock did in the 50\'s-60\'s... Although I will always be a Rock\'n\'Roll fan!
